00064 struct BMesh *BKE_mesh_to_bmesh(struct Mesh *me, struct Object *ob);
00065 
00066 /*
00067  * this function recreates a tessellation.
00068  * returns number of tessellation faces.
00069  *
00070  * use_poly_origindex sets whether or not the tessellation faces' origindex
00071  * layer should point to original poly indices or real poly indices.
00072  *
00073  * use_face_origindex sets the tessellation faces' origindex layer
00074  * to point to the tessellation faces themselves, not the polys.
00075  *
00076  * if both of the above are 0, it'll use the indices of the mpolys of the MPoly
00077  * data in pdata, and ignore the origindex layer altogether.
00078  */
00079 int mesh_recalcTessellation(struct CustomData *fdata, struct CustomData *ldata, struct CustomData *pdata,
00080                            struct MVert *mvert,
00081                            int totface, int totloop, int totpoly,
00082                            const int do_face_normals);
00083 
00084 /* for forwards compat only quad->tri polys to mface, skip ngons.
00085  */
00086 int mesh_mpoly_to_mface(struct CustomData *fdata, struct CustomData *ldata,
00087     struct CustomData *pdata, int totface, int totloop, int totpoly);

00192 /* UvVertMap */
00193 
00194 #define STD_UV_CONNECT_LIMIT    0.0001f
00195 
00196 typedef struct UvVertMap {
00197     struct UvMapVert **vert;
00198     struct UvMapVert *buf;
00199 } UvVertMap;
00200 
00201 typedef struct UvMapVert {
00202     struct UvMapVert *next;
00203     unsigned int f;
00204     unsigned char tfindex, separate, flag;
00205 } UvMapVert;
00206 
00207 /* UvElement stores per uv information so that we can quickly access information for a uv.
00208  * it is actually an improved UvMapVert, including an island and a direct pointer to the face
00209  * to avoid initializing face arrays */
00210 typedef struct UvElement {
00211     /* Next UvElement corresponding to same vertex */
00212     struct UvElement *next;
00213     /* Face the element belongs to */
00214     struct BMFace *face;
00215     /* Index in the editFace of the uv */
00216     struct BMLoop *l;
00217     /* index in loop. */
00218     unsigned short tfindex;
00219     /* Whether this element is the first of coincident elements */
00220     unsigned char separate;
00221     /* general use flag */
00222     unsigned char flag;
00223     /* If generating element map with island sorting, this stores the island index */
00224     unsigned short island;
00225 } UvElement;
00226 
00227 
00228 /* UvElementMap is a container for UvElements of a mesh. It stores some UvElements belonging to the
00229  * same uv island in sequence and the number of uvs per island so it is possible to access all uvs
00230  * belonging to an island directly by iterating through the buffer.
00231  */
00232 typedef struct UvElementMap {
00233     /* address UvElements by their vertex */
00234     struct UvElement **vert;
00235     /* UvElement Store */
00236     struct UvElement *buf;
00237     /* Total number of UVs in the layer. Useful to know */
00238     int totalUVs;
00239     /* Number of Islands in the mesh */
00240     int totalIslands;
00241     /* Stores the starting index in buf where each island begins */
00242     int *islandIndices;
00243 } UvElementMap;
00244 
00245 /* invalid island index is max short. If any one has the patience
00246  * to make that many islands, he can bite me :p */
00247 #define INVALID_ISLAND 0xFFFF
00248
